```{r}
### 6.Full Search
if (interactive()) {
  mode <- tolower(trimws(readline("Enter mode ('r' for random, 'm' for manual): ")))
} else {
  mode <- "r"
}

if (mode == "r") {
  chosen <- sample(1:50, 1)
  cat("Randomly chosen number:", chosen, "\n")
} else if (mode == "m") {
  if (interactive()) {
    input <- readline("Enter an integer: ")
    chosen_num <- suppressWarnings(as.integer(input))
    if (is.na(chosen_num)) stop("Invalid input: please enter an integer.")
    chosen <- chosen_num
  } else {
    chosen <- 20
    cat("Default number selected for knitting:", chosen, "\n")
  }
} else {
  stop("Invalid mode. Use 'r' or 'm'.")
}

if (chosen < 1 || chosen > 50) {
  cat("The number selected is beyond the range of 1 to 50\n")
} else if (chosen == 20) {
  cat("TRUE\n")
} else {
  cat("Selected number:", chosen, "\n")
}
```

```{r}
### 7.Change
min_bills <- function(price) {
  bills <- c(1000, 500, 200, 100, 50)
  count <- 0
  
  remaining <- price
  
  for (b in bills) {
    if (remaining >= b) {
      n <- remaining %/% b     # how many of that bill
      count <- count + n
      remaining <- remaining - n*b
    }
  }
  
  return(count)
}

price <- sample(seq(50, 5000, by = 50), 1)
cat("Price of snack:", price, "\n")
cat("Minimum bills needed:", min_bills(price), "\n")
```

### D. Without using the max function, output as follows for students whose highest score for a semester exceeds 90 points..

```{r}

for (i in 1:nrow(math_scores)) {
  
  grades <- c(math_scores$Grade1[i], math_scores$Grade2[i], math_scores$Grade3[i], math_scores$Grade4[i])
  

  highest <- grades[1]          
  for (g in grades) {
    if (g > highest) {
      highest <- g
    }
  }
  
  if (highest > 90) {
    cat(math_scores$Name[i], "'s highest grade this semester is", highest, "\n")
  }
}

```
